name: Park Plaza Victoria London

reviews.text: Wonderful location convenient for rail /bus and restaurants Friendly helpful staff.Gorgeous Jubilee Floral Display in Foyer
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: Contemporary hotel, although we reported air con not working at once, never fixed however lovely bathroom.Probably would be a good idea for staff to regularly check age wear of beds some springs felt !!!!!! .All in all I would stay there again though
reviews.title: Well located but tired!

reviews.text: As other reviews mention, it is a great location for sightseers and theatre goers, the hotel is clean and well-designed, but, the main criteria for a business stay in London is a decent nights sleep and that wasn't possible. The curtains didn't quite fill the window, so was blinded at 4:30am, rewoken at 6 by an impossibly located tapping noise and then kept awake from 7 by housekeeping, seemingly, playing with dodgem cars in the hallway. It's in an extremely busy part of London and double glazing can only help so much - so getting to sleep might be difficult for some.
reviews.title: What a great Hotel!

reviews.text: Tried the sauna and steam room which was a bit of an experience as they are practically in the gym, plonked outside the changing rooms, enough room for 4 people if they all breathe in - I'd leave the swimwear at home.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent location

reviews.text: I have stayed here a couple of times before and have always enjoyed the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel for all types of visitors

reviews.text: It is well situated for train and underground travel as Victoria station is on a couple of tube lines - most of London is only 1 or 2 changes away.
reviews.title: London Marathon Weekend

reviews.text: The hotel looks good and has a welcoming and open reception lobby which is next to the bar/reception - this is very useful when meeting friends or having impromptu meetings.
reviews.title: modern hotel, good location

reviews.text: The rooms are pretty standard but to a good quality. My last room had a faulty plug in the sink, but reception were quick to offer me a new room which was good.
reviews.title: Park Plaza London Stay
Good place, but could be better...
reviews.text: Tv has a wide range of channels including sky sports and most of the news channels. Free wifi is good, certainly good for Skype etc.

I stayed in this hotel 2 years' ago with friend and loved it but on a trip to London last week made the huge mistake ( as I was trying to save money ) of booking a single room at a hotel called the Euston Square Hotel. It turned out to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I was booked in for 2 days , was actually bookedin , in total for 5 hours, and spent no more than 1 hour in the horrible, pokey, dingy room . I phoned Park Plaza Victoria London almost in tears. The horrible hotel at Euston was £90 per night , the Park Plaza room was £150 per night but in terms of size (my room must have been 4 times the size of the £90 broom cupboard at Euston), quality, comfort, cleanliness, security and service were more than worth every penny. Receptionists were brilliant when I got there.
reviews.title: This hotel saved my London trip from disaster

reviews.text: Park Plaza will have my loyalty from now on.
reviews.title: Easy access to the Tube, close to Westminster, nice neighborhood

reviews.text: The rooms here are fantastic, like apartments. It is quiet except when the garbage trucks are loading the trash bins at midnight! But I would recommend this for easy access to Victoria station, a 10 minute walk to Westminster and free wi fi in the lobby.
reviews.title: Big Improvement Since Last Stay
Everything we needed and more
reviews.text: Have stayed previously at Park Plaza Victoria, selected for location for attending an event near the hotel, our last stay was not the best with various issues but was promised an upgrade on next visit. We paid for an executive room with breakfast and access to executive lounge, then upgraded to an executive studio room. Which certainly has more space and a seperate walk in shower.

Check in easy, fast and helpful staff. Room was clean, bathroom tiling starting to show its age. Breakfast was taken in the executive lounge, very good service and quality and range of buffet both hot and cold fine.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: We stayed in the Park Plaza on the weekend of the Proms in the Park in September, there was four of us in total with two rooms. The room size was very good and with excellent bathrooms. Everything in the rooms was very clean and modern. We were able to check in early and nothing was to much trouble for the staff. We would definitely stay here again. Two minute walk to the tubes.
reviews.title: Had a great weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Park Plaza was very enjoyable. Our room was larger than usual by European standards. It was comfortable, and the staff was very courteous, knowledgable, and helpful. The location was excellent, with Victoria Station almost across the street. Would stay there again and recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: Great Location with Excellent Staff

reviews.text: Top class and good value for money not riciculously overpriced like so many london hotels. Really great location, 2 minutes from Tube etc, greay staff and lovely rooms. All in all an excellent hotel for buisness or leisure.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Great Location, My new choice in London,

reviews.text: Very good hotel in the heart of London for the business traveller. All staff went to great lengths to make me feel comfortable and this is complimented by fresh and well maintained rooms with all the equipment you need in a modern hotel. Really useful for the business traveller. Woke up feeling very refreshed. Did not get to eat there as left early having arrived late the previous night. Would definitely recommend the accommodation though!
reviews.title: Could not fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just spent a weekend in this hotel with my wife for her birthday and our wedding anniversary, and we were both more than impressed! I booked this via a website deal that included tickets to see Grease at the Piccadilly Theatre two months in advance. I called the hotel the week before our stay to request an early check in, as official check in time is 2pm and we had to get ready for a 3pm matinee performance of Grease. They couldnt promise anything but made a note on our reservation. In reality, there were many people, including ourselves, that checked in at 12pm. Check in was quick and easy, and we were in our room within minutes! Our room was a double executive and was huge! Nice comfy king size bed, large tv, tea and coffee facilities, big stylish bathroom. Had lunch at Wetherspoons pub 2 minutes from hotel, service there was excellent, and food well priced. Then got taxi to Piccadilly which only cost £9. Show was excellent and we finished up dining at the Michelin Star Criterion Restaurant in Piccadilly, £24 pp for a 3 course meal from their set menu which was great value for money. Bus 38 back to Victoria station which is then a 3 minute walk to the hotel, a great day and night was had! Breakfast is expensive at around £16pp, although our breakfast was suprisingly paid for by the agent we used at no cost to us! If this isnt the case for you, althought the breakfast was very good, the cheaper version at Weatherspoons may be the way to go. Overall, the hotel location, service, food and accommodation are definatly worth a 5/5!
reviews.title: Great Location, wonderful hotel!
Great location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a few days before a cruise. We picked the hotel for its central location - and we couldn't have picked better. It is within walking distance of the Victoria Train Station (where you can get the District and Circle subway lines) and the Victoria Bus Terminal. It is also on the Pimlico bus route. Many places e.g.; Buckingham Palace, Westminster Cathedral are easily walkable from the hotel. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The front desk staff is very helpful and recommended some great local restaurants away from the tourist area. The rates are reasonable for London. In summary an excellent hotel with a great location. This is now where we stay when we visit London.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Plaza in June for our trip to Wimbledon. Not only did the concierge help us get tickets to Wimbledon, the service was top notch. When we got to London two days late due to a flight cancellation, the hotel refunded our first two nights with no questions asked. We did book a superior room and had a nice king size bed and the bathroom was modern. Overall, the hotel was clean and a good size for a european hotel room. In terms of location, you can't ask for a better location in London. We were about 3 blocks from the Victoria train station givin us full access to London by train. There are also a few theaters within walking distance that were showing Billy Elliott and Wicked. For service, price and location, I would definitely stay here again when visiting London. The hotel driver also gave us a ride to Paddington station for much less than a taxi ride.

reviews.title: Great location, pleasant stay.
reviews.text: Myself and two other members of my family had the pleasure of staying in this lovely hotel. The staff were so helpful with any of our queries as we had never stayed in London before. They were very professional in the way they dealt with their customers. Our room was in perfect condition-although the view was nothing spectacular.

reviews.title: Great location, very clean; don't bother with the Plus package
reviews.text: While there are great tea/coffee making facilities it would have been helpful to have had a small fridge.

reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for anything better!
reviews.text: Breakfast was nothing to boost about-your standard breakfast that you would expect at any hotel. It would have been better if the waiter/waitress left a pot of tea for us as we had to keep asking for our tea to be topped up.

reviews.title: Best hotel ever !
reviews.text: My family and I stayed here last weekend having booked the hotel on it's website. The hotel is 2 stops on the tube from Oxford Street and within walking distance of Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Houses of Parliament. There are lots of restaurants close by including several within a very unusual steel & glass building that also has marks & Spencer ( can't remember name of road but it's beside the theatre where Billy Elliott is on)

reviews.title: Would certainly return when in the area again
reviews.text: All members of staff were welcoming & friendly. We had booked an executive suite and were delighted to discover that the room had 2 Walls completely of glass and a balcony all the way around . This may be the only room with a balcony though.

reviews.title: The bedroom let down the hotel.
reviews.text: During the night , whilst in bed my husband found an insect crawling on his back which freaked him out. However the staff were extremely helpful in dealing with the situation and when we changed rooms , they gave us a free up grade to a 2 bed appt with 2 bathrooms, kitchen & sitting room. They also offered free dinner/ drinks but we did not avail of this as there are so many restaurants close by.

reviews.title: Avoid Room 901 - Over Priced and Over Valued
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean with the exception of the beige carpets which are stained throughout the hotel.

reviews.title: The hotel was perfect. We loved it!!
reviews.text: Apologies for any typos as I'm using my phone to type the review.

Well situated hotel for those wishing to visit central London, rail, bus and underground within five minutes walk, friendly efficient staff, bright modern foyer and reasonable fitness facilities. The downside of being assigned a room with connecting doors means you can hear what's going on next door so I suggest you ask for one without. Overall, I had a very enjoyable four day stay here andI would use this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. Easy access to the undeground and overground trains as well as buses makes the whole of the UK accessible, not just London.
reviews.title: Great location
Shockingly inflexible front desk ...
reviews.text: The hotel itself is looking a little tired. Our suite was spacious but cold - the heating did not work and we had to be given a stand alone heater - not something I would expect from a hotel of this star rating. Our bed was made each day but in 6 nights we had no change of linen - is this normal for London? There was one comfy chair in the suite area the others were not any good for sitting on but looked lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate breakfast at the hotel and this was superb. The staff were professional, helpful and quick to react to any request. Stay here for a great location and an average hotel room.
reviews.title: Excellent location...excellent value

reviews.text: What had been a pretty standard stay for a professionally managed business conference turned into a wholly unsatisfactory experience when my wife checked out.
reviews.title: A wonderful trip with our grandson.

reviews.text: I only had a very short stay at the Park Plaza Victoria due to a too late arrival and very early departure. It is a nice and appealing modern business hotel. The fact that I was upgraded at check in to an appartment was nice, but showed that they have some overbooking issues. The check-in staff was very friendly but only moderately efficient. When I got to my room the key did not work, so I had to go down to the reception again. I got a new key but was also escorted back to the room by a very friendly staff member to ensure I could get into my room. Due to the upgrade I had a very spacious room with kitchenette, which was in impeccable condition and extremly clean.
reviews.title: Nice, but some problems

reviews.text: Although I can probably give no direct fault to the hotel, there was a fire alarm at 3.20 am which took me and the rest of the hotel out onto the streets of London. Given my strenuous travel schedule I was not pleased about this at all. I did expect some form of compensation on the rather expensive room rate at check out, but all I got was a letter of apology from the Manager on Duty. In addition I was also miffed about the fact that this hotels cancellation policy is 2 pm (vs. the regular 6pm) same day, as my travel plans had changed on short notice and it would have been better from me to stay closer to Heathrow. However, I could not get out of this reservation and therefore had to deal with the expense and time to travel into the city.
reviews.title: Worst value for money I have ever had - beware misleading price quotes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it seems like a good hotel though and a place that can be recommended. Some of the experiences I made were rather circumstantial and are not likely to be encountered by other travelers. I do think that the value offered for the the room rate I paid @ GBP 233 is questionable, but then it is central London.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel (which I have used many times for business) for a special treat for my daughter's birthday. When I got there I was informed that the price had been quoted did not include VAT, which incurred abother £70 cost. On complaining about this, the Duty Manager said she would waive the additional charge for the extra (camp) bed in our room. WHAT EXTRA CHARGE!? Having checked the confirmation email on my return, the VAT was cunningly included lower down and no extra charge for the bed was mentioned at all. This was deliberately misleading in my view. The camp bed was so uncomfortable I hardly slept and thanks to the noisy neighbours next door and thin walls we were awoken at around 07:00 the next morning. They also delivered newspapers I had not ordered and added them to the bill. This is a lovely hotel normally but I think money-grabbing has taken over from service.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.text: Everything from the time we entered until the time we left , was fantastic. Room was super nice and large. Staff were a delight. Will be staying there again. Hotel is close to many attractions. We walked to Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and The London Eye.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!!

reviews.text: We managed to book reasonable priced rooms for this centrally located hotel. Rooms are spacious (not very common in London) and with tv, minibar, kettle and coffee machine. Buffet breakfast wasn't included, but we could've get it for 13£ each. The location is a short walk from Victoria station - meaning a lot of restaurants and shops nearby. The service was also efficient and polite. Everything worked as it should, recommended!
reviews.title: Good location for city travel

reviews.text: I booked two rooms at this hotel on a recommendation from a friend. It's in a fantastic location for transport to Gatwick as the express train leaves from Victoria station 5 mins walk away. There are shops and restaurants nearby which are good options for breakfast . Marks and Spencer's simply food is around the corner great for nibbles and wine for the afternoon. It's walking distance to Westminster abbey and st James park, buckingham palace. Our rooms were different, one had a sitting area and bedroom and the other was a standard room. The larger room was perfectly clean but unfortunately the other was less so. The floor had not been vacuumed and there were toenail clippings from a previous occupant on the carpet. I told reception and was told it would be dealt with but I was disappointed that no further mention was made of the problem. A message of apology from housekeeping would have been nice.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in great location for attractions and transport

reviews.text: There is a nice bar at the hotel and though we didn't partake, breakfast is available for 13 pounds fifty and it is allegedly good quality and value.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again as it represents good value for London and is well located.
reviews.title: Good choice near Victoria Station
Phenomenal!
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing, stayed here 17th - 19th June 2011 and moved it. Booking next June for 5 days too! Rooms huge and very clean. Always quiet and food was delicious. Looks fantastic too!. Beds were brilliant and extremely comfy. Cannot wait to go back! Best hotel ever!

reviews.title: POSITION
reviews.text: This hotel has very friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.title: Nice Modern Hotel Conveniently Located
reviews.text: Location is excellent as Victoria train station and local bus stations very close. Walking distance to many attractions eg: Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace

reviews.title: Clean and serviceable with friendly service (but boring)
reviews.text: Restaurants, supermarket and local hotels to eat at - only a few yards/metres away.

reviews.title: Awesome hotel, great section of London
reviews.text: I stayed in this Hotel for one night recently while in London on business. I was travelling in from Gatwick on the express to Victoria Station so this hotel couldn't have been better situated as it is about 2 minutes walk from the station.

We enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza Victoria London. It's in a great location, just minutes from Victoria station and a short walk to Westminster Abbey. The room was clean, quiet, and provided ample space to open up a large suitcase.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located to London Victoria station which is only a bare a few minutes walking time away . The lobby is spacious and bright and the staff are friendly. Check-in was efficient. I was given their Golden Points Plus card which they said allowed the customer to accumulate points leading to reductions in the fullness of time.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff. Expensive food

reviews.text: The bedroom was small but not cramped. The bed was exceptionally soft but a bit short . The room furnishings were maintained well and the room was neat and clean. The airconditioning worked well and the glazing was enough to keep out the street noises. The hotel was quiet at night.
reviews.title: Good hotel when you get a discounted rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinking glasses in the bathroom needed a good wash but everything else was fine. The towels were a good size and fluffy. The shower worked and there was a good and uninterrupted flow of warm water.
reviews.title: Our new favorite hotel in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't use the restaurant but ordered food in the lounge area. Unfortunately this was a bit too expensive and thereafter ate across the road in a small but pleasant cafe.
reviews.title: Not as good as we expected...

reviews.text: I stayed here recently for a couple of nights for a weekend in London with some friends. The hotel has a great location and is handy for various nearby attractions as well as Victoria station which you can use to travel to areas of London further away. Hotel is modern, with good staff, clean rooms, large rooms and was a very reasonable price. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with Reasonable Rates

reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Plaza Victoria London recently, and got it through bidding on Priceline-we bid on a 4 star location in Westminster-we wanted a convenient location for sightseeing and airport connections. This fit the bill! It is located on a quiet side street near Victoria Train Station and a little longer walk from Victoria Coach station. Lobby is modern and spacious, staff very helpful and rooms very functional and quiet. Bathrooms were wonderful-separate shower and big tub, nice sink area and all nicely appointed. Lots of restaurants, cafe's and pubs very close by. It was a good stay for us and met our needs quite nicely.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visiting London for the first time and having chosen our six-night accommodations based on map location and TripAdvisor reviews, we were very pleased with the Park Plaza. Located next to Victoria station and within a 10-minute walk to the coach station, we were able to shuttle from Heathrow on National Express to the station in one hour and all for five pounds for two seniors (!) rather than the thirty-three pounds plus cab fare or underground using the more publicized Heathrow Express train. Most of our visited sites were within walking distance from the Plaza: Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and Westminster Cathedral, Harrod's and Hyde Park, Piccaddily, Trafalgar Square, and many others.
reviews.title: A fine choice for tourists

reviews.text: All tour busses pick up at the front door.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very similar to what would be standard in the states--large bath, king bed, desk, AC. The room and bath were clean and neat each day and the staff was helpful. Two small negatives: the web browser accessed through the room tv did not function for three of the days (told that was not uncommon) and my wife felt that the carpet was getting a tired look (although very clean). Tip: an excellent alternative to the hotel breakfast (unless it is included in your package) is the Pret a Mange across the street with healthy choices and great Americano coffee.
reviews.title: Excellent brief stay-- comfy and convenient

description: Adjacent to Victoria Station - Sleek, modern lobby - Rooms have modern business amenities - Heathrow 16 miles - Gatwick 26 miles.
